title: On Reactive Programming
snippet: Well, some say the Creator took a handful of sand and - wait, no. Why are we here? Why ReactiveUI? Tough question. There are many MVVM frameworks although not as many as there used to be, but one thing that always seems to happen if you ask on Stack Overflow is you'll get all kinds of advice and one bit in particular which stuck with me...

title: The Blazor MVVM Compelling Example
snippet: I hope by now people are starting to learn about the existence of the ReactiveUI.Blazor package. Blazor means writing Single Page Apps like Angular or Vue in C# and it has all the potential in the world. And ReactiveUI supports it. The official samples are here but I don't feel that they really sell the reason why you'd want to do web work with ReactiveUI, and I should know, I wrote them..."

I hate NullReferenceExceptions. There's a very simple reason why you don't get it in Rx, of course, and that's because both IEnumerable and IObservable are a sort of a collection, and a collection is special in LINQ and Functional Programming terms because of how you apply functions to it...
title: On Elevated Values
